position.marginalia_text: Igitur &Conjunction; &Saturn; et &Mars; in &Aquarius; no[n] ta[n]tu[m] nocet.

marginalia.translation: Therefore the conjunction of Saturn and Mars in Aquarius does not only harm.

position.marginalia_text: Vide Albumasaris Introductionis lib 7. capite 4. de &Conjunction; &Saturn; &Mars; &Sun; cu[m] &Saturn; vel &Mars; [etc].

marginalia.translation: See book 7, chapter 4 of Albumasar's 'Introductorium' regarding the conjuncition of Saturn, Mars, and the Sun, with Saturn or Mars, et cetera.
How much a conjuction differs from a trine for men.

marginalia.anchor_text: Omnes ergo bonorum aspectus boni, malorum mali, Sed diligenter animaduertere oportet, qui planetae boni sint, qui mali, est tamen trinus & sextilis melior, qu&m quadratus uel oppositus

position.marginalia_text: O[mn]es aspectus bonoru[m], no[n] simpliciter; sed eo modo quo mox ante dixit: attame[n] ordine[m] viriu[m] co[n]sidera.

marginalia.translation: All aspects of good [things] [are] not [to be paid attention to] in a straightforward manner, but in that manner which soon he said before: nevertheless examine the order of large bodies.

position.marginalia_text: Na[m] fortuna nocebit et adiuvabit te infortuna, in hoc casu

marginalia.translation: For fortune will kill and infortune will help you, in this case.

position.marginalia_text: Si nocet, proportione viriu[m] rei nocentis considerata qua[n]tu[m] nocet, [scies]

marginalia.translation: If it harms, with the proportion of large bodies considered for the matter of harm, how much it harms, you will know.

position.marginalia_text: hic author vtitur &Moon;a ad tot vel plura significata:

na[m] in fo 26 pro vita / vxorib[us] sive co[n]cubinis / pro itinere / sororib[us] anim[a]e qualitate / matre ita et fo. 59. pro corpore [..] et in eo loco vide q[uam] multa significata singulis planetis tribuit, si hoc facere est absurdum [etc].

marginalia.translation: This author uses the moon for all or many signifiers: for in folio 26 for life; for women or concubines; for travel; for sisters; for the quality of the soul; for the mother; thus even folio 59, for the body [..] and in that place see how he attributes many signifiers of each planet, if to do this is absurd.

underline.text: tunc enim est in forma coniunctionis receptae
Omnes ergo bonorum aspectus boni, malorum mali, Sed diligenter animaduertere oportet, qui planetae boni sint, qui mali, est tamen trinus & sextilis melior, qu&m quadratus uel oppositus
augent malitiam supra corpus, quando sunt malae radiationes

mark.name: bracket
mark.text: Omnes ergo bonorum aspectus boni, malorum mali, Sed diligenter animaduertere oportet, qui planetae boni sint, qui mali, est tamen trinus & sextilis melior, qu&m quadratus uel oppositus

mark.name: bracket
mark.text: quadratus & oppositio augent malitiam supra corpus, quando sunt malae radiationes: & minuut bonum ratio contrarietatis
